Class WorldGameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.cooperroalson.untitled_thinggy_thingg.core.gamestates.WorldGameState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameState

    public class WorldGameState
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameState
    An implementation of GameState that runs the world and player.

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the world. Does this by calling MapState.update() and updateScreenCoordinates().
        Specified by:
        update in interface GameState

      • draw

        public java.util.List<Drawable> draw()
        Compiles a list of Drawables, which will be drawn to the screen by the WindowManager. These Drawables are from the Player, Blocks, Tiles, and Entitys currently on-screen.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface GameState
        Returns:
        A List of Drawables

      • registerKeyBindings

        public javax.swing.ComponentInputMap registerKeyBindings(javax.swing.JComponent component)
        Registers/activates the current keybindings by adding them to the JPanel's InputMap. It does this using Controls.getInputMap().
        Specified by:
        registerKeyBindings in interface GameState
        Parameters:
        component - The GamePanel
        Returns:
        An input map with all the key mappings

      • registerActionMap

        public void registerActionMap()
        Registers the Actions associated with this GameState. This should only occur once per class (you should probably use a static boolean field to keep track of this). It does this using Controls.getActionMap().
        Specified by:
        registerActionMap in interface GameState
